com.ep.ggs.world

Interface Level

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChunkLevel, ClassicLevel

    public interface Level

    • Method Detail

      • generateWorld

        void generateWorld(Generator<?> g)
        Generate a world
        Parameters:
        g - The Generator object that will generate the world.

      • isAutoSaveEnabled

        boolean isAutoSaveEnabled()
        Whether or not this level will autosave. AutoSave will save the level every minute and save when the level is unloaded.
        Returns:
        True if the level will autosave, false if it will not.

      • hasUpdated

        boolean hasUpdated()
        Returns whether or not this level has changed since the last time it was saved.
        Returns:
        True if the level has changed, false if it has not.

      • setAutoSave

        void setAutoSave(boolean set)
        Set Whether the level will autosave or not. AutoSave will save the level every minute and save when the level is unloaded.
        Parameters:
        set - True if the level will autosave, false if it will not.

      • loadProperties

        void loadProperties()
        Load the properties for the level.

      • getLevelProperties

        Properties getLevelProperties()
        The properties for this level
        Returns:
        A Properties object for this level.

      • getTile

        Block getTile(int x,
            int y,
            int z)
        Get a block at the X, Y, Z coordinates
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate
        y - The Y coordinate
        z - The Z coordinate
        Returns:
        The block at those coordinates

      • getTile

        Block getTile(int i)
        Get a block in this level
        Parameters:
        index - Which block to get
        Returns:
        The block at that index

      • setTile

        void setTile(Block b,
           int x,
           int y,
           int z,
           Server server)
        Set a block in this world. If the block is a physicsblock, it will be added to the physics tick. This method wont send out a change to the clients. To do this, use Player#GlobalBlockChange(short, short, short, ClassicBlock, ClassicLevel, Server) instead
        Parameters:
        b - The block to add
        x - The X coordinate
        y - The Y coordinate
        z - The Z coordinate
        server - The server this blockchange is happening in

      • rawSetTile

        void rawSetTile(int x,
              int y,
              int z,
              Block block,
              Server server,
              boolean addToTick)
        Changes the block at the specified coordinates to the specified block without checking for any physics changes If you change a block in a level, it won't be sent to clients
        Parameters:
        x - - The x coordinate
        y - - The y coordinate
        z - - The z coordinate
        block - - The block to change to
        server - - The server
        addtick - - Whether this block should be added to the tick.

      • setNewSpawn

        void setNewSpawn(int WaterLevel)

      • save

        void save()
          throws IOException
        Save the level
        Throws:
        IOException - An IOExceptoin is thrown if there is a problem writing to the file

      • unload

        void unload(Server server)
            throws IOException
        Unload this level. All players who are in this level will be sent to the Server.MainLevel. This level will save before unloading if isAutoSaveEnabled() is set to true.
        Parameters:
        server - The server thats unloading the level
        Throws:
        IOException - An IOException will occur if there is a problem saving the level

      • unload

        void unload(Server server,
          boolean save)
            throws IOException
        Unload this level. All players who are in this level will be sent to the Server.MainLevel
        Parameters:
        server - The server thats unloading the level
        save - Whether the level should save before unloading
        Throws:
        IOException - An IOException will occur if there is a problem saving the level

      • backup

        void backup(Server server,
          String location)
            throws BackupFailedException
        This method will save the level, and copy the level file to a backup location specified.
        Parameters:
        server - The server making the backup.
        location - The location of the backup folder
        Throws:
        BackupFailedException - This exception is thrown if there was an IOException while backing up the level.

      • load

        void load(String filename,
        Server server)
          throws IOException
        Load a level and return the level
        Parameters:
        filename - The file to load and read
        Throws:
        IOException - An IOException is thrown if there is a problem reading the level

      • addTick

        PhysicsBlock addTick(int x,
                   int y,
                   int z,
                   Block b,
                   Server server)
        Add a block to the Physics Tick
        Parameters:
        x - The X cord. of the block
        y - The Y cord. of the block
        z - The Z cord. of the block
        b - The block to add to ticking
        server - The server the block belongs to
        Returns:
        A copy of the PhysicsBlock added to the tick.
